Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read a sentence fragment and select what you think people might do after this event.
task: select possible things that the event participants might want to do after
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed actions that you think make sense, using the following definitions:

    After, others want answers the question "what will others likely want to do next, after this event?"
    Other people could be either explictly mentioned (e.g. "PersonY") or implied to be included in the event (e.g. a "classroom" usually contains students).
    If the event could sometimes have other people and sometimes not have them, then answer the questions including those other people.
    NOTE: Some events won't involve any other participants, in which case you should select the "none" option.
examples:
Event After, others want:
Others might want to...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: After, others want —  What do other people affected by the event likely want to do next after this event? Select all that apply.
note:
Other people means PersonY, PersonZ, and people included but not mentioned in the event.
Select "none" if this event only affects PersonX or affects no one.
event: personx does not make too much noise
xAtt11: to see what they are doing
xAtt16: to wonder what personx is doing
xAtt17: to tell personx to be quiet
xAtt21: to see what personx is doing
xAtt23: to know what personx is doing
xAtt24: to know why personx is so quiet
Answer.qxAtt: to be quiet|to stay quiet|to see what they are doing|to keep quiet|to wonder what personx is doing|to see what personx is doing|to know why personx is so quiet

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read an event description and select which words would describe the person doing the event.
task: select possible descriptions/attributes of the person doing it
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed attributes that you think make sense, using the following guidelines:

  • For each event, think about how you would describe PersonX, based on their participation in the event.
  • For each description, think about what attributes PersonX might typically have. Adjectives will usually be appropriate.
  • Avoid descriptions of PersonX's feelings.
examples:
Event possible descriptions/attributes for PersonX:
PersonX is...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: PersonX attributes: What adjectives best describe PersonX in this event? Select all that apply.
note: Avoid feelings or words that appear in the event.
none: (there are no good words to describe PersonX)
event: personx does not meet the band
Answer.qxAtt: incompetent|unprepared|unmotivated|unskilled|irresponsible|disappointed|annoying|not talented|lacking|untrained

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read an event and select which effects it has on its participants.
task: select possible (mostly involuntary) effects that it has on its participants
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed effects that you think make sense, using the following guidelines:

  • Focus on specific physical or mental effects.
  • Events which happen to people are events which they do not choose to do.
  • Events which happen to people should not include feelings.
examples:
Event possible effects on PersonX:
PersonX...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: Effect on PersonX —  What are some possible effects of this event on PersonX? Select all that apply.
event: personx does not lose track of time
Answer.qxAtt: worries

title: Read an event description and select which words would describe the person doing the event.
task: select possible descriptions/attributes of the person doing it
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed attributes that you think make sense, using the following guidelines:

  • For each event, think about how you would describe PersonX, based on their participation in the event.
  • For each description, think about what attributes PersonX might typically have. Adjectives will usually be appropriate.
  • Avoid descriptions of PersonX's feelings.
examples:
Event possible descriptions/attributes for PersonX:
PersonX is...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: PersonX attributes: What adjectives best describe PersonX in this event? Select all that apply.
note: Avoid feelings or words that appear in the event.
none: (there are no good words to describe PersonX)
event: personx does not pay taxes
Answer.qxAtt: irresponsible|inconsiderate|unlucky|careless|undependable|lazy|absentminded|absent minded|reckless|immoral|cheap|unaware|impulsive|poor

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read a sentence fragment and select what you think people might do before this event.
task: select possible things that the person doing the event might need to do before
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed actions that you think make sense, using the following definitions:

    Before, PersonX needs answers the question: "does PersonX typically need to do anything before this event?"
    NOTE: Some events might not be caused willingly by PersonX, in which case you should select the "none" option.
examples:
Event Before, PersonX needs:
PersonX needs to (do)...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: Before, PersonX needs —  What does PersonX need to do before this event? Select all that could apply.
note: Select "none" if the event happens to PersonX, i.e., PersonX doesn't cause the event willingly.
event: personx does not bite personx's nails
xAtt24: to put their hands on their nails
Answer.qxAtt: go to the salon|to go to the salon|to get a nail clipper

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read an event and select which effects it has on its participants.
task: select possible (mostly involuntary) effects that it has on its participants
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed effects that you think make sense, using the following guidelines:

  • Focus on specific physical or mental effects.
  • Events which happen to people are events which they do not choose to do.
  • Events which happen to people should not include feelings.
examples:
Event possible effects on PersonX:
PersonX...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: Effect on PersonX —  What are some possible effects of this event on PersonX? Select all that apply.
event: personx does not notice a strange smell

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read a sentence fragment and select what you think people might do after this event.
task: select possible things that the event participants might want to do after
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed actions that you think make sense, using the following definitions:

    After, others want answers the question "what will others likely want to do next, after this event?"
    Other people could be either explictly mentioned (e.g. "PersonY") or implied to be included in the event (e.g. a "classroom" usually contains students).
    If the event could sometimes have other people and sometimes not have them, then answer the questions including those other people.
    NOTE: Some events won't involve any other participants, in which case you should select the "none" option.
examples:
Event After, others want:
Others might want to...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: After, others want —  What do other people affected by the event likely want to do next after this event? Select all that apply.
note:
Other people means PersonY, PersonZ, and people included but not mentioned in the event.
Select "none" if this event only affects PersonX or affects no one.
event: personx does not look angry
xAtt16: to make sure they are ok
xAtt18: to tell personx to calm down
xAtt24: to understand why personx is not angry
Answer.qxAtt: to ignore personx|to listen to personx|to forgive personx|to console personx|to calm down personx|to avoid him|to console him|to calm down|to give personx a hug|to laugh|to leave|to understand why personx is not angry

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event

Event possible Others's reactions

PersonX draws the line

xAtt21: happy to have their wallet back
xAtt24: glad to have their wallet back

instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed reactions that you think make sense, using the following definitions:

 

    PersonX's reaction answers the question "how does PersonX typically feel after the event?"
examples:
Event possible PersonX's reactions
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: PersonX's reactions —  How does PersonX typically feel after the event? Select all that apply.
event: personx does not beat everyone
Answer.qxAtt: like a loser|disappointed|unhappy|competitive

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read a sentence fragment and select what you think people might do after this event.
task: select possible things that the event participants might want to do after
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed actions that you think make sense, using the following definitions:

    After, others want answers the question "what will others likely want to do next, after this event?"
    Other people could be either explictly mentioned (e.g. "PersonY") or implied to be included in the event (e.g. a "classroom" usually contains students).
    If the event could sometimes have other people and sometimes not have them, then answer the questions including those other people.
    NOTE: Some events won't involve any other participants, in which case you should select the "none" option.
examples:
Event After, others want:
Others might want to...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: After, others want —  What do other people affected by the event likely want to do next after this event? Select all that apply.
note:
Other people means PersonY, PersonZ, and people included but not mentioned in the event.
Select "none" if this event only affects PersonX or affects no one.
event: personx does not make it through the day
xAtt11: to see how they are doing
xAtt19: to tell them they are welcome
xAtt20: to make sure they do well
xAtt22: to make sure personx is ok
xAtt23: to make sure they do their chores
xAtt24: to make sure they do not miss anything
Answer.qxAtt: to cheer them up|to talk to personx|to keep personx safe|to help them out|to see how they did|to call personx|to help personx|to congratulate them|to see them do well|to have fun|to help him|to make sure they do well|to celebrate|to make sure they do their chores|to make sure they do not miss anything

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read a sentence fragment and select what you think people might do before this event.
task: select possible things that the person doing the event might need to do before
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed actions that you think make sense, using the following definitions:

    Before, PersonX needs answers the question: "does PersonX typically need to do anything before this event?"
    NOTE: Some events might not be caused willingly by PersonX, in which case you should select the "none" option.
examples:
Event Before, PersonX needs:
PersonX needs to (do)...

PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift

PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: Before, PersonX needs —  What does PersonX need to do before this event? Select all that could apply.
note: Select "none" if the event happens to PersonX, i.e., PersonX doesn't cause the event willingly.

xAtt24: to drive to the band's location

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read an event description and select which words would describe the person doing the event.
task: select possible descriptions/attributes of the person doing it
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed attributes that you think make sense, using the following guidelines:

  • For each event, think about how you would describe PersonX, based on their participation in the event.
  • For each description, think about what attributes PersonX might typically have. Adjectives will usually be appropriate.
  • Avoid descriptions of PersonX's feelings.
examples:
Event possible descriptions/attributes for PersonX:
PersonX is...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: PersonX attributes: What adjectives best describe PersonX in this event? Select all that apply.
note: Avoid feelings or words that appear in the event.
none: (there are no good words to describe PersonX)
event: personx does not rain on personx's parade
Answer.qxAtt: careless|lazy|annoyed|determined|rude|silly|irresponsible|disappointed|prepared|thoughtless|mean|independent

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read an event and select which effects it has on its participants.
task: select possible (mostly involuntary) effects that it has on its participants
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed effects that you think make sense, using the following guidelines:

  • Focus on specific physical or mental effects.
  • Events which happen to people are events which they do not choose to do.
  • Events which happen to people should not include feelings.
  • Other people could be either explictly mentioned (e.g. "PersonY") or implied to be included in the event (e.g. a "classroom" usually contains students).
    If the event could sometimes have other people and sometimes not have them, then answer the questions including those other people.
    NOTE: Some events won't involve any other participants, in which case you should select "none".
examples:
Event possible effects on others:
Others...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: Effect on others —  What are some possible effects of this event on others? Select all that apply.
note:
Other people means PersonY, PersonZ, people included but not mentioned in the event.
Select "none" if this event only affects PersonX or affects no one.
event: personx does not want to learn karate
xAtt24: does not want to teach personx
Answer.qxAtt: loses a friend|talks to personx|has to teach them|they teach him|they teach them|have to teach personx|tries to teach them|they teach personx karate|wants them to learn|yell

  • Focus on specific physical or mental effects.
  • Events which happen to people are events which they do not choose to do.
  • Events which happen to people should not include feelings.
examples:
Event possible effects on PersonX:
PersonX...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: Effect on PersonX —  What are some possible effects of this event on PersonX? Select all that apply.
event: personx does not learn new things

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read a sentence fragment and select what you think people might do before this event.
task: select possible things that the person doing the event might need to do before
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed actions that you think make sense, using the following definitions:

    Before, PersonX needs answers the question: "does PersonX typically need to do anything before this event?"
    NOTE: Some events might not be caused willingly by PersonX, in which case you should select the "none" option.
examples:
Event Before, PersonX needs:
PersonX needs to (do)...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: Before, PersonX needs —  What does PersonX need to do before this event? Select all that could apply.
note: Select "none" if the event happens to PersonX, i.e., PersonX doesn't cause the event willingly.
event: personx does not advertise personx's business
xAtt21: to think of what to say
xAtt22: to think about what to say
xAtt24: to not want people to know
Answer.qxAtt: to start a business|to put up flyers|to create a business|to write a business plan|to not have a business|to decide to not advertise|to advertise|to get a business plan|to get a business|to think of a business|to think about what to say|money

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read an event description and select which words would describe the person doing the event.
task: select possible descriptions/attributes of the person doing it
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed attributes that you think make sense, using the following guidelines:

  • For each event, think about how you would describe PersonX, based on their participation in the event.
  • For each description, think about what attributes PersonX might typically have. Adjectives will usually be appropriate.
  • Avoid descriptions of PersonX's feelings.
examples:
Event possible descriptions/attributes for PersonX:
PersonX is...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: PersonX attributes: What adjectives best describe PersonX in this event? Select all that apply.
note: Avoid feelings or words that appear in the event.
none: (there are no good words to describe PersonX)
event: personx does not shout persony's name

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read a sentence fragment and select what you think people might do after this event.
task: select possible things that the event participants might want to do after
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed actions that you think make sense, using the following definitions:

    After, others want answers the question "what will others likely want to do next, after this event?"
    Other people could be either explictly mentioned (e.g. "PersonY") or implied to be included in the event (e.g. a "classroom" usually contains students).
    If the event could sometimes have other people and sometimes not have them, then answer the questions including those other people.
    NOTE: Some events won't involve any other participants, in which case you should select the "none" option.
examples:
Event After, others want:
Others might want to...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: After, others want —  What do other people affected by the event likely want to do next after this event? Select all that apply.
note:
Other people means PersonY, PersonZ, and people included but not mentioned in the event.
Select "none" if this event only affects PersonX or affects no one.
event: personx does not get everything ready
xAtt16: for them to get it done
xAtt18: to tell them they did well
xAtt20: to tell them they are welcome
xAtt21: to tell personx to hurry up
xAtt22: to make sure everything is done
xAtt24: to tell them they did a good job

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read an event description and select which words would describe the person doing the event.
task: select possible descriptions/attributes of the person doing it
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed attributes that you think make sense, using the following guidelines:

  • For each event, think about how you would describe PersonX, based on their participation in the event.
  • For each description, think about what attributes PersonX might typically have. Adjectives will usually be appropriate.
  • Avoid descriptions of PersonX's feelings.
examples:
Event possible descriptions/attributes for PersonX:
PersonX is...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: PersonX attributes: What adjectives best describe PersonX in this event? Select all that apply.
note: Avoid feelings or words that appear in the event.
none: (there are no good words to describe PersonX)
event: personx does not call persony the next day
Answer.qxAtt: absentminded|careless|rude|absent minded|distracted|reserved

title: Read an event description and select which words would describe the person doing the event.
task: select possible descriptions/attributes of the person doing it
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed attributes that you think make sense, using the following guidelines:

  • For each event, think about how you would describe PersonX, based on their participation in the event.
  • For each description, think about what attributes PersonX might typically have. Adjectives will usually be appropriate.
  • Avoid descriptions of PersonX's feelings.
examples:
Event possible descriptions/attributes for PersonX:
PersonX is...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: PersonX attributes: What adjectives best describe PersonX in this event? Select all that apply.
note: Avoid feelings or words that appear in the event.
none: (there are no good words to describe PersonX)
event: personx does not rent an apartment
Answer.qxAtt: irresponsible|unprepared|needy|frugal|unemployed|unsuccessful|careless|homeless|desperate|tired|sad|unsure|decisive

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read a sentence fragment and select what you think people might do before this event.
task: select possible things that the person doing the event might need to do before
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed actions that you think make sense, using the following definitions:

    Before, PersonX needs answers the question: "does PersonX typically need to do anything before this event?"
    NOTE: Some events might not be caused willingly by PersonX, in which case you should select the "none" option.
examples:
Event Before, PersonX needs:
PersonX needs to (do)...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: Before, PersonX needs —  What does PersonX need to do before this event? Select all that could apply.
note: Select "none" if the event happens to PersonX, i.e., PersonX doesn't cause the event willingly.
event: personx does not catch persony's attention
xAtt24: to think of what to say
Answer.qxAtt: to approach persony|to find persony|to look for persony|to find person y|to go to persony|to sneak up on persony|xAttOther

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read a sentence fragment and select what you think people might do after this event.
task: select possible things that the event participants might want to do after
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed actions that you think make sense, using the following definitions:

    After, others want answers the question "what will others likely want to do next, after this event?"
    Other people could be either explictly mentioned (e.g. "PersonY") or implied to be included in the event (e.g. a "classroom" usually contains students).
    If the event could sometimes have other people and sometimes not have them, then answer the questions including those other people.
    NOTE: Some events won't involve any other participants, in which case you should select the "none" option.
examples:
Event After, others want:
Others might want to...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: After, others want —  What do other people affected by the event likely want to do next after this event? Select all that apply.
note:
Other people means PersonY, PersonZ, and people included but not mentioned in the event.
Select "none" if this event only affects PersonX or affects no one.
event: personx does not have many friends
xAtt18: to find someone to talk to
xAtt24: to tell personx to go away
Answer.qxAtt: to ignore personx|to make new friends|talk to personx|to talk to personx|to avoid him|hang out with personx|to have fun with personx|to be friends with personx|to ask personx out|to go out with personx|to hang out with personx|to get to know personx|to tell personx to go away

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read an event and select which effects it has on its participants.
task: select possible (mostly involuntary) effects that it has on its participants
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed effects that you think make sense, using the following guidelines:

  • Focus on specific physical or mental effects.
  • Events which happen to people are events which they do not choose to do.
  • Events which happen to people should not include feelings.
examples:
Event possible effects on PersonX:
PersonX...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: Effect on PersonX —  What are some possible effects of this event on PersonX? Select all that apply.
event: personx does not look like a woman
Answer.qxAtt: is mistaken for a man|is mistaken|is looked at as strange

Title: Select Options that Apply to an Given Event
Description: Given an event, please select all options that apply to such event
title: Read an event and select which effects it has on its participants.
task: select possible (mostly involuntary) effects that it has on its participants
instruction:
Your task is to select all of the listed effects that you think make sense, using the following guidelines:

  • Focus on specific physical or mental effects.
  • Events which happen to people are events which they do not choose to do.
  • Events which happen to people should not include feelings.
  • Other people could be either explictly mentioned (e.g. "PersonY") or implied to be included in the event (e.g. a "classroom" usually contains students).
    If the event could sometimes have other people and sometimes not have them, then answer the questions including those other people.
    NOTE: Some events won't involve any other participants, in which case you should select "none".
examples:
Event possible effects on others:
Others...
PersonX takes the test
PersonX goes to the movies
PersonX gives PersonY ___ as a gift
PersonX yells at the classroom
PersonX is very worried
PersonX draws the line
question: Effect on others —  What are some possible effects of this event on others? Select all that apply.
note:
Other people means PersonY, PersonZ, people included but not mentioned in the event.
Select "none" if this event only affects PersonX or affects no one.
event: personx does not look like hell
Answer.qxAtt: scolds personx|yells at personx|look at personx|they laugh at him|scolds person x|cries|gets scared|they laugh
